entry.author: Jim Finkle
entry.headline: IBM says it may acquire security companies
entry.body:
BOSTON (Reuters) - IBM, which plans to spend a record $1.5 billion next year to develop and market security products, is seriously looking at using acquisitions to help beef up its offerings in that area, a company executive told Reuters on Thursday.

The company, whose third-quarter revenue climbed 7 percent to $24 billion, sees security as a key to growth, said Val Rahmani, IBM's general manager of infrastructure management for global technology services.

"We're looking at a lot of different companies right now, as we always do in a number of different spaces within security," she said in a telephone interview.

A year ago International Business Machines paid $1.23 billion to buy Internet Security Systems. Rahmani declined to say when IBM might make its next purchase of a security company, or whether it was considering deals that size or larger.

It is IBM's policy never to identify specific businesses that it might buy, to discuss deals that it has considered, or comment on any speculation about its acquisition activities, she added.

But she identified some areas that IBM is interested in: "Keeping the bad guys out and letting the good guys in, authenticating people once they are in and worrying about data if people leave it behind."

IBM already has "pretty good coverage...but we could always do better," she added.

She also said companies that are most attractive acquisition candidates are ones that can help IBM better predict future threats.

"This is about understanding where the threats will be before they happen," she said. "This is what we are very focused on," she said.

She spoke to Reuters as IBM announced next year's $1.5 billion budget for developing and marketing its security business.

It is looking to handle security in house, instead of letting that work go to outside firms that specialize in security.

Smaller companies such as McAfee Inc, Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. and Websense Inc. say they have an edge over big technology companies like IBM because they are able to focus on security.

IBM argues it has an advantage because it is able to integrate security into every aspect of a company's technology systems operations. Key competitors in services include Electronic Data Systems Corp. and Accenture Ltd.

IBM spent more than $5 billion in 2006 on acquisitions, mainly for software companies in a drive to expand its most profitable business.

(Reporting by Jim Finkle, additional reporting by Justin Grant in New York)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Hayes sets pace at Disney
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - J.P. Hayes birdied five of the last nine holes to forge one stroke clear in the Disney Classic first round in Lake Buena Vista on Thursday.

Bidding for his third PGA Tour title, Hayes fired a seven-under-par 65 on the Magnolia course, one of two venues hosting the final event of the 2007 season.

Cameron Beckman, boosted by an eagle on his opening hole, returned a flawless 66 on the Magnolia layout for a three-way share of second spot.

Also at six under were Scott Verplank, who twice chipped in for birdie, and Japan's Ryuji Imada after starting out on the neighboring Palm course at the Walt Disney World Resort.

South African Tim Clark opened with a 67 to lie two strokes off the pace in a group of eight which also included former major winner Justin Leonard and U.S. Presidents Cup player Woody Austin.

Hayes, whose last PGA Tour victory came at the 2002 John Deere Classic, birdied three of the first four holes before bogeying the sixth for an outward nine of two-under 34.

The 42-year-old Wisconsin native then covered the homeward nine in a blistering five under par to edge one shot clear.

Victory apart, the biggest incentive for many of the players in the Tour's season finale is to secure playing privileges for 2008.

The leading 125 in the final money list automatically earn full exemption for next year and Ted Purdy held the 125th spot going into this week with earnings of $758,734.

Hot on his heels were big-hitting J.B. Holmes, with $754,616, and beefy Kevin Stadler, with $737,276.

Purdy opened with a 70 on the Palm course, finishing level with Holmes who played the Magnolia layout. Best of the trio was Stadler who shot a 69, also on the Magnolia course.

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Mexico doubles size of huge cocaine haul
entry.body:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico's discovery of a huge cocaine shipment from Colombia grew even larger on Thursday as the government more than doubled the size of the haul to 23 tons, making it one of the world's biggest drug busts.

Police, navy and customs officers found the drugs, the second major seizure in the past month, hidden between plastic floor-covering on a Hong Kong-flagged container ship at the Manzanillo port in Colima state on Tuesday.

They initially announced they found 11 tons but further searches of the ship revealed far more.

"So far, the haul amounts to more than 23 tons of cocaine. This is the biggest seizure of this drug in the country's history," the government said in a statement.

It was the latest blow to drug gangs since President Felipe Calderon deployed thousands of troops across Mexico to attack the dominant Gulf and Sinaloa cartels after taking office last December.

The seizure doubles the Mexican record, set only last month when soldiers found more than 11 tons of cocaine at the port of Tampico on the Atlantic coast.

Officials in Manzanillo have so far checked six containers on the Colombian boat, two of which were packed with cocaine divided into more than 21,000 packets. The search continues.

The seizure "is further proof of President Calderon's commitment to cripple drug lords and bring them to justice," U.S. Ambassador Antonio Garza said in a statement.

He put the value of the cocaine at $400 million.

But the U.S. government said last month the average price of the drug on U.S. streets had risen to $118.70 per gram in the first six months of the year. That would give the Mexican haul an implied value of some $2.7 billion.

Around 2,350 people have been killed in Mexico this year in drug violence, most of it between rival drug gangs.

Last month, a private jet with nearly 4 tons of cocaine aboard crashed into a southern Mexican jungle.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Petrobras to acquire Exxon Japan refinery -paper
entry.body:
TOKYO Nov 2 (Reuters) - Brazil's state oil company Petrobras (PETR4.SA) (PBR.N) will take a majority stake in an Exxon Mobil group (XOM.N) refinery in Okinawa, Japan, in a deal estimated at several billion yen, the Nikkei business daily said on Friday.

Petrobras will acquire the entire 87.5 percent interest in the oil refiner owned by Exxon Mobil subsidiary TonenGeneral Sekiyu KK (5012.T) in an agreement to be signed this month, the paper said.

After the purchase, Petrobras and Japanese trading house Sumitomo Corp (8053.T), which owns the other 12.5 percent of the refinery, will spend up to 100 billion yen ($870 million) to upgrade the facilities, the paper said.

Oil traders have been closely following the development of the deal since it first emerged about a year ago.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon Mobil says court overturns $3.5 bln verdict
entry.body:
NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) said on Thursday that the Alabama Supreme Court has overturned a $3.5 billion decision against the company, stemming from a lawsuit over royalty payments to the state.

In 2003, a jury found Exxon Mobil committed fraud in the calculation of royalties it paid to the state on production from its Mobile Bay natural gas wells, the company said.

Under the decision, Exxon was told to pay $3.5 billion in punitive damages to the state.

In its appeal, the company argued the state had improperly turned a contract dispute into a fraud action, the company said. (Reporting by Emily Chasan)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Francois Schott
entry.headline: Hingis tests positive for cocaine and retires
entry.body:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Former world number one Martina Hingis said on Thursday she had tested positive for cocaine during Wimbledon this year and announced her retirement from professional tennis.

"I have tested positive but I have never taken drugs and I feel 100 percent innocent," the five-times grand slam champion from Switzerland told a news conference.

Fighting back tears and with her voice cracking, Hingis read from a written statement before leaving the room without answering questions.

In an expanded version of the statement later released by her management, the 27-year-old said she found the accusation of drug-taking "so horrendous, so monstrous, that I have decided to confront it head-on by talking to the press."

The statement added: "I would personally be terrified of taking drugs. When I was informed (about the test) I was shocked and appalled."

Hingis added that she had undergone a private test that came back negative and consulted an attorney.

"The attorney and his experts discovered various inconsistencies with the urine sample that was taken during Wimbledon.

"He is also convinced that the doping officials mishandled the process and would not be able to prove that the urine that was tested for cocaine actually came from me."

Hingis said she had also been advised that any fight to clear her name could drag on for years.

"I have no desire to spend the next several years of my life reduced to fighting against the doping officials," she said. "I am frustrated and angry.

"I believe that I am absolutely, 100 percent innocent. The fact is that it is more and more difficult for me, physically, to keep playing at the top of the game.

"And frankly, accusations such as these don't exactly provide me with motivation to even make another attempt to do so."

She added: "And so, considering this situation, my age and the problems I have been having with my hip, I have decided to no longer play tennis on the Tour."

After rising to the top of her sport with a much-admired blend of grace and tactical astuteness, Hingis suffered a string of injuries that forced her to first hang up her racket in 2003.

SURPRISE RETURN

She made a surprise return to the courts in 2006, proving her doubters wrong as she went on to win two more titles and end the year as world number seven.

A further, final, title followed in Tokyo this year before her injury problems returned.

In October, Hingis announced an early end to her season, citing hip problems.

Thursday's media conference was widely expected to see the former world number one announcing her retirement -- but not in the circumstances now set out.

The WTA Tour released a brief statement from chief executive officer Larry Scott on Thursday, mainly paying tribute to Hingis's achievements on the court.

"The WTA Tour has not received any official information regarding the positive doping test result referred to... and as a result we are not in a position to comment," Scott began before going on to praise the player's "incredible touch, on-court intelligence and off-court professionalism."

Switzerland's national tennis association also highlighted Hingis's attributes as a player.

"Martina Hingis was a great player who was always a role model and a figurehead for Swiss tennis," association president Rene Stammbach said in a statement.

"We regret very much that Martina is ending her career faced with these recriminations."

(Additional writing by Mark Ledsom in Berne)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Beckman and Verplank set early Disney pace
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - American journeyman Cameron Beckman holed a 36-foot birdie putt on his final hole for a share of the early first-round lead at the Disney Classic in Lake Buena Vista on Thursday.

Bidding for his second PGA Tour title, Beckman fired a flawless six-under-par 66 on the Magnolia course, one of two venues hosting the 2007 PGA Tour's final event.

Also at six under was U.S. Presidents Cup player Scott Verplank, who rattled up six birdies on the neighboring Palm course at the Walt Disney World Resort.

South African Tim Clark opened with a 67 on the Magnolia layout to lie one stroke off the pace with Americans Dicky Pride and Vaughn Taylor.

Beckman, whose only PGA Tour victory came at the 2001 Southern Farm Bureau Classic, set the tone for a memorable day by eagling his opening hole, the par-five 10th.

He then picked up further shots at the 11th, 16th and 17th to reach the turn in five-under 31.

The 37-year-old Minnesota native parred the next eight holes before signing off in style with his long-range putt on the ninth green.

Victory apart, the biggest incentive for many of the players in the Tour's season finale is to secure playing privileges for 2008.

The leading 125 in the final money list automatically earn full exemption for next year and American Ted Purdy held the 125th spot going into this week with earnings of $758,734.

Hot on his heels were big-hitting J.B. Holmes, with $754,616, and beefy Kevin Stadler, with $737,276.

Purdy opened with a 70 on the Palm course, finishing level with compatriot Holmes who played the Magnolia layout. Stadler was among the late starters.

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

entry.author: Michael Erman
entry.headline: Slim gasoline margins drive down Exxon earnings
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp. (XOM.N) said on Thursday its third-quarter earnings declined 10 percent, missing expectations on sharply dropping profits from gasoline production and lower natural gas prices.

Exxon's stock fell about 2.7 percent in afternoon trading and was a weight on the Dow Jones Industrial Average .DJI, which was down 1.9 percent.

Margins to produce and sell gasoline and other refined products fell sharply during the quarter, accounting for more than two-thirds of the drop in profits from last year.

The plummeting refining margins cut into gains from an oil price surge that saw crude hit $78 in September before marching on to new records in the fourth quarter.

Net income at the world's largest publicly traded company fell to $9.41 billion, or $1.70 a share, from $10.49 billion, or $1.77 a share, a year earlier.

Analysts, on average, had expected the company to earn $1.74 a share, according to Reuters Estimates.

Refining margins crashed by as much as 90 percent from record highs reached in May, as the summer driving season ended, oil prices surged and gasoline prices did not keep up with the price increases.

These reduced profits have also dragged down earnings at Exxon's largest competitors, BP Plc (BP.L), Royal Dutch Shell Plc (RDSa.L), and ConocoPhillips (COP.N), offsetting oil prices that were much higher than a year before.

The margins have remained tight in the fourth quarter, threatening to hold back earnings even as U.S. crude prices have surged over $90 a barrel.

"There's a real blood bath in refining margins right now, and that will largely offset the higher upstream earnings," said John S. Herold analyst Lysle Brinker.

SECOND DROP IN A ROW

It is the first time since 2002 that the company has had two consecutive quarterly earnings drops -- a period marked by a wild bull market for oil during which crude prices have tripled.

Exxon has been hugely profitable over those years, pulling in more than $155 billion in profits.

Even now, the company is just $300 million behind last year's earnings for the first nine months of 2006, a year when it posted the largest full-year profit in U.S. history.

Revenue in the third-quarter rose 2.8 percent to $102.34 billion, a new record for the company.

Profits from its refining and marketing unit fell to $2 billion, down $737 million on the lower margins.

Earnings from Exxon's exploration and production operations slipped 3 percent to $6.3 billion on lower natural gas prices and higher expenses.

Oil and gas production in the quarter fell 2 percent, due in part to shifts from production-sharing agreements with host countries, OPEC quotas and the loss of projects that were seized by the Venezuelan government.

For big oil companies like Exxon, high oil prices have brought huge profits, but have also invited resource-rich countries like Nigeria, Kazakhstan, and Canada to reexamine their contracts with the companies.

James Halloran, who helps invest about $35 billion at National City Private Client Group, said these arrangements were cutting into Exxon's international profits.

"There's kind of a plateauing of what you can make in international because of production-sharing agreements," Halloran said. "And it's only going to get worse ... There's a trend here, and it's really going to be tough for companies to get a handle on as much of the upside from production as they used to."

STILL SEEING DEMAND GROWTH

The company's average oil price rose about 12 percent in the U.S. and 9 percent abroad, while its natural gas prices fell 14 percent in the U.S., 3 percent in Europe and 4 percent elsewhere.

Exxon's Vice President of Investor Relations Henry Hubble said the company is still seeing some demand growth for its products despite high prices.

"The rate of growth is a little bit less than what we've seen in some previous years," Hubble said on a call with reporters.

"But basically we're continuing to see year-on-year growth, a lot of that coming in the Asia Pacific market. In the U.S., we're about flat this year."

Shares of Exxon fell $2.45 to $89.54 on the New York Stock Exchange on Thursday afternoon.

Through Wednesday's close, Exxon's shares were up about 20 percent this year, underperforming the Chicago Board Options Exchange's Oil Index .OIX, which rose about 29 percent over the same period.

(Reporting by Michael Erman)

entry.headline: UPDATE 4-Slim gasoline margins drive down Exxon earnings

entry.author: Mathieu Robbins
entry.headline: JP Morgan among bidders for Norweb- sources
entry.body:
LONDON Nov 1 (Reuters) - U.S. investment bank JP Morgan's (JPM.N) infrastructure arm is among bidders shortlisted to submit binding offers for United Utilities' (UU.L) power distribution business Norweb, said people familiar with the matter.

The fund, which last month led a group that agreed to buy Southern Water from Royal Bank of Scotland (RBS.L) for 4.2 billion pounds including debt, is among those invited to submit offers in November for Norweb, the people said on Thursday.

The business is expected to fetch between 1.3 billion pounds ($2.7 billion) and 1.5 billion, including debt assumed.

Australia's Macquarie Bank MBL.AX, which had initially taken part in the process and was hotly tipped by observers as a candidate to buy the business, has now pulled out of the auction, the people said, adding the Australian bank had decided the business is too small and the auction too competitive.

Others expected to make binding second-round offers include Hong Kong-based Cheung Kong Infrastructure (1138.HK) and Bahrain-based buyout firm Arcapita, which also owns Northern Irish power company Viridian, the people said.

While these offers are technically the second round, about seven bidders had been asked to reaffirm their first-round bids after due diligence last month before being whittled down to a smaller number who will bid this month.

Utilities are viewed as relatively safe assets in an economic downturn so are more isolated than most from the global credit crunch, initially sparked by concerns over U.S. subprime mortgages.

Financial bidders are prominent in the auction of Norweb, whose wires carry electricity to the inhabitants of Manchester in northwest England, because rival utilities have been put off by terms of the sale, which include United Utilities keeping a contract to operate the business, said the sources.

United Utilities, Arcapita, Macquarie and JP Morgan all declined to comment.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: IBM to spend $1.5 bln on security
entry.body:
BOSTON (Reuters) - IBM, the world's largest technology services company, said on Thursday it will spend a record $1.5 billion next year to develop and market security products.

International Business Machines Corp announced its plans about a year after it bought security company Internet Security Systems for $1.23 billion in October 2006. IBM has integrated that business into its services division.

Its strategy is to boost revenue by selling security products alongside its bread-and-butter technology services, hardware and software, instead of losing sales to outside firms that specialize in security.

Smaller firms such as McAfee Inc, Check Point Software Technologies Ltd. and Websense Inc. say they have an edge over big technology companies like IBM because they are able to focus on security.

IBM argues it has an advantage because it is able to integrate security into every aspect of a company's technology systems operations. Key competitors in services include Electronic Data Systems Corp. and Accenture Ltd.

IBM spent more than $5 billion in 2006 on acquisitions, mainly for software companies in a drive to expand its most profitable business.

(Reporting by Jim Finkle, additional reporting by Justin Grant in New York)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: US STOCKS-Futures drop on Citi shares; Exxon profit
entry.body:
(Updates to show stock futures hitting session lows on Exxon)

By Jennifer Coogan

NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - U.S. stock index futures were sharply lower on Thursday after a provocative downgrade of Citigroup (C.N) and write-downs at Credit Suisse, suggesting the mortgage crisis may claim more casualties.

Adding to pressure, Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) reported earnings that fell short of expectations and crude oil topped $96 a barrel overnight.

Stocks will likely surrender the sharp gains they made Wednesday, when the Federal Reserve cut the benchmark fed funds rate a quarter percentage point to 4.5 percent.

Credit Suisse said its third-quarter investment banking profit was all but wiped out by write-downs in leveraged loan commitments, residential mortgages and collateralized debt obligations. For details, see [ID:nL01556375].

In another troubling sign for financial shares, CIBC World Markets downgraded Citigroup (C.N) to "sector underperformer," citing capital concerns for the biggest U.S. bank, while Credit Suisse cut Citigroup to "neutral" from "outperform".

CIBC also downgraded Bank of America (BAC.N) to "sector performer", saying its sees a diminished revenue outlook for the bank.

"When you have the biggest, supposedly safest financial company being accused of not having enough capital, what does that say about a lot of other banks?" said Peter Boockvar, equity strategist, Miller Tabak Co in New York. "It's a major issue and it's not just Citigroup. All these banks have the same problem."

SP 500 futures SPc1 were down 17.6 points, below fair value, a mathematical formula that evaluates pricing by taking into account interest rates, dividends and time to expiration on the contract.

Dow Jones industrial average futures DJc1 fell 131 points, and Nasdaq 100 NDc1 futures were down 19.5 points.

Exxon shares were down 2 percent to $90.15 in pre-market trading.

Citigroup shares fell 3.2 percent to $40, a four and a half year low, while Bank of America shares were down 1.8 percent to $47.40.

Indexes briefly pared some of their declines after a set of September inflation readings largely matched economists' forecasts.

Shares of Crocs (CROX.O) plunged 25 percent after the trendy plastic shoe maker's profit outlook trailed Wall Street forecasts.

In heavy volume before the market open, the stock tumbled $18.90 to $55.85 after ending Wednesday's regular session at $74.75. Ahead of the news, the stock hit a record $75.21 in intraday trading on Wednesday and had more than quadrupled in the last year.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: U.S. STOCKS-Futures slump on Citigroup, Exxon
entry.body:
(Updates with further decline in Citigroup, Exxon)

NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - U.S. equity index futures fell sharply on Thursday after Citigroup (C.N) shares tumbled to below $40 for the first time in four-and-a-half years in pre-market trading.

Futures briefly pared losses after readings of inflation and unemployment claims were in line with forecasts, but they resumed their downward trajectory after Citigroup shares slumped further following a brokerage downgrade. A weaker-than-expected profit report from Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) was also worrying to investors.

Standard Poor's 500 index futures SPc1 were down 19.3 points, well below fair value, indicating the market could open down 1 percent or more.

entry.headline: Exxon shares down after earnings miss
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Shares of Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) fell about 2 percent before the bell on Thursday after the oil company's profit appeared to miss Wall Street's estimates.

The stock was off $1.84 at $90.15 in electronic trading before the market open. The stock closed Wednesday at $91.99.

entry.headline: US STOCKS-Futures drop on Exxon profit
entry.body:
(Updates to show stock futures hitting session lows on Exxon)

NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - U.S. stock index futures dropped on Thursday, suggesting the market will open lower, after Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) reported earnings that fell short of expectations.

SP 500 futures SPc1 were down 11.8 points, below fair value, a mathematical formula that evaluates pricing by taking into account interest rates, dividends and time to expiration on the contract.

Dow Jones industrial average futures DJc1 fell 56 points, and Nasdaq 100 NDc1 futures down 11 points.

Exxon shares were down 2 percent to $90.15 in pre-market trading.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon Mobil earnings fall with gasoline profits
entry.body:
NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp. (XOM.N) said on Thursday its third-quarter earnings declined 10 percent as profits from the production of gasoline slipped.

Net income at the world's largest publicly traded company fell to $9.41 billion, or $1.70 a share, from $10.49 billion, or $1.77 a share, a year earlier.

Margins to produce gasoline and other refined products fell sharply during the quarter, dragging down earnings at most integrated oil companies that both drill for and refine the fuel.

Refining margins plummeted by as much as 90 percent from record highs reached in May as the summer driving season ended, oil prices surged and gasoline prices did not keep up with the price increases.

Shares of Exxon are up about 20 percent this year, underperforming the Chicago Board Options Exchange's Oil Index .OIX, which rose about 29 percent over the same period. (Reporting by Michael Erman)

FILED UNDER:

entry.headline: Exxon Mobil misses by $0.04, misses on revs
entry.body: Reports Q3 (Sep) earnings of $1.70 per share, $0.04 worse than the Reuters Estimates consensus of $1.74; revenues rose 2.8% year/year to $102.34 blnnot comparable tothe $112.97 bln single estimate. Chairman comments,"ExxonMobil's third quarter net income was $9,410 million ($1.70 per share), down 10% from the third quarter of 2006, while earnings per share were down 4% for the same period. The decrease reflected lower downstream and chemical margins partly offset by higher crude oil realizations. Net income of $28,950 million for the first nine months of 2007 was $300 million lower than the record first nine months of 2006. Earnings per share increased 6% during the same period, reflecting the positive impact of the continuing share purchase program".

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-Portland General Electric 3rd-qtr profit climbs
entry.body:
(Adds details)

NEW YORK Nov 1 (Reuters) - Oregon utility Portland General Electric (POR.N) posted higher third-quarter earnings on Thursday, lifted by declining depreciation expense and benefits from an Oregon utility income tax law.

Net income was $20 million, or 32 cents per share, compared with $10 million, or 16 cents per share, a year earlier.

Revenue climbed 17 percent to $435 million, helped by an increase in customers and benefits from the Oregon utility income tax law.

The company stood by its 2007 earnings outlook of $2.25 to $2.35 per share, which includes a one-time item of 41 cents per share from a deferred power costs.

It set its 2008 earnings target of $1.75 to $1.85 per share.

The average forecast of analysts anticipates $2.16 per share in 2007 and $1.97 per share in 2008, according to Reuters Estimates. (Reporting by Justin Grant)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Chevron Indonesia plans to expand geothermal power
entry.body:
JAKARTA Nov 1 (Reuters) - Chevron Geothermal Indonesia Ltd, a unit of Chevron Corp. (CVX.N), plans to expand its geothermal power capacity to meet growing electricity demand in the Southeast Asian country, a company official said on Thursday.

Chevron currently has geothermal power plants with a total capacity of around 365 megawatts (MW) in West Java province.

"We are very keen to expand our geothermal capacity. We are considering whether we can expand from our operation in West Java," Usman Slamet, a Chevron official, told reporters on the sidelines of an energy conference.

He did not specify a time frame.

Indonesia, dotted with hundreds of active and extinct volcanoes, has the potential to produce an estimated 27,000 MW of electricity from geothermal sources.

However, the vast potential remains largely untapped because of the high cost of generating electricity from geothermal sources.

"Chevron has no problem regarding financing and technology. We are looking for possibilities to expand our geothermal projects in other areas in Indonesia," Slamet said.

Indonesia, Asia Pacific's only OPEC member, is tapping alternative energy sources to meet rising power demand and to cut consumption of expensive crude oil as its own reserves dwindle.

Simon Sembiring, the directorate general of geothermal and mineral resources, said earlier this year many foreign firms were interested in investing in geothermal energy projects in Indonesia.

The firms include Icelands's Reykjavik Energy Invest which signed a preliminary deal on Oct. 23 with Indonesia's state oil firm Pertamina to develop a geothermal power plant.

Mines and energy minister Purnomo Yusgiantoro said in February that electricity generated from geothermal sources could rise to 9,500 MW by 2025 from 850 MW,.

Indonesia, with its ageing power plants, needs to increase electricity supply to avoid shortages in the world's fourth-most populous country, where power demand is estimated to be growing at around 10 percent a year.

entry.headline: Disney, Hanesbrands sign deal for park apparel
entry.body:
(Corrects typographical error in headline)

(Changes dateline from NEW YORK, adds details, comment from Disney)

LOS ANGELES, Oct 31 (Reuters) - Walt Disney Co (DIS.N) and Hanesbrands Inc (HBI.N) said on Wednesday they agreed to a ten-year deal that will make Hanes and Champion the exclusive suppliers of basic T-shirts and other apparel at Walt Disney's U.S. resorts and parks.

Terms of the deal, which includes fleece sweatshirts, sweatpants and hoodies, were not disclosed.

The Disneyland and Walt Disney World resorts will continue to sell other manufacturers' lines of upscale T-shirts and clothing at their stores, Meg Crofton, president of Walt Disney World Resort, said.

The deal also calls for some apparel to be co-labeled, with names such as "Disneyland Resort by Hanes," "Walt Disney World by Hanes," and "ESPN Zone by Champion."

Under the agreement, Hanes will sponsor and have signage at the Rock 'n' Roller Coaster Starring Aerosmith at Disney-MGM Studios and will have locations where visitors can personalize T-shirts and other items.

The stadium at Disney's Wide World of Sports Complex will be renamed for Champion, and both brands of clothing will be offered and promoted at Disney's eight ESPN Zone restaurants.

Disney has other long-standing corporate partnerships that are featured throughout the U.S. parks but this is the first to result in co-branding of merchandise, Crofton said.

Although the partnerships result in more advertising within the resorts, Crofton said Disney has seen no resistance from visitors.

"Quite the opposite: it's one of the reasons we choose our partners so carefully," Crofton said. "Our guests love to see brands they know ... and associate with quality."

((Reporting by Martinne Geller; editing by Deborah Cohen; Reuters messaging: martinne.geller.reuters.com@reuters.net; martinne.geller@reuters.com; +1 646 223 6023)) Keywords: DISNEY HANESBRANDS/

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-Chemoil, JP Morgan in fuel derivatives alliance
entry.body:
(Adds details, and quotes)

SINGAPORE Nov 1 (Reuters) - Marine fuel firm Chemoil said on Thursday it had reached a deal with JPMorgan that would give its clients access to the U.S. bank's derivatives business, while JPMorgan could benefit from Chemoil's physical fuel supplies.

Singapore-listed Chemoil Energy CHEL.SI and JPMorgan (JPM.N) did not disclose financial terms or other details of the agreement.

Chemoil said the new alliance would offer customers such as shipowners and airlines a one-stop station to not just buy physical barrels, but also hedge that exposure through the service alliance formed by the two companies.

It said shipping companies will now be able to hedge their exposure more than 12-months out, but will also retain the option to convert the swap into physical oil at the agreed port of call.

"So if your paper is for Singapore, you can convert it to physical barrels in Singapore," Chemoil's chief executive officer Robert Chandran said, adding that the two companies is expected to release more details on the deal in 90 days.

Chemoil, which listed its stock in Singapore last December, said it has the largest share of the marine fuel market in Los Angeles. Chemoil stock rose nearly 3 percent to $0.535 in early trade on Thursday.

The alliance marks a push more than two-years ago by Wall Street banks to have a greater presence in physical oil trade.

Having a foothold in the physical market gives banks such as JP Morgan an edge, as cut-throat competition threatens to squeeze margins on the core business of hedging volatile energy prices for airlines, producers and industries. (Additional reporting by Luke Pachymuthu)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Verplank moves one stroke clear at Disney
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - Scott Verplank, helped by six birdies in his first nine holes, grabbed a one-shot lead in the Disney Classic second round at Lake Buena Vista on Friday.

The U.S. Presidents Cup player fired a six-under-par 66 on the Magnolia course, one of two venues hosting the final event of the 2007 PGA Tour season.

Bidding for his sixth Tour title, Verplank raced to the turn in six-under 30 before parring the last nine holes in blustery conditions for a 12-under total of 132.

"I kind of lost my rhythm a little bit and struggled to find it," the 43-year-old told reporters at the Walt Disney World Resort. "It got windier as the day went on and it's a different direction than you normally see around here.

"But I got on such a nice roll in the first nine holes that I didn't kill myself by making a bunch of pars."

Stephen Ames reeled off seven consecutive birdies on his way to a best-of-the-week 63 on the Palm layout and a tie for second place with Americans Tag Ridings (66) and Ryan Armour (64).

Ames launched his red-hot run at the par-five first, his 10th hole of the day, before running up a three-putt bogey at the ninth where he missed a three-footer to save par.

"It was more the putter than anything else that was working for me today," the 43-year-old Trinidad native said after covering his homeward nine in six-under 30.

LEFT SHORT

"I was trying to make nine birdies in a row and (hole) seven was a good up-and-down for birdie. Then I hit a four-iron to about 20 feet (at the eighth) and I thought I'd make that one too. But I didn't, I left it short."

Twice PGA Tour winner Ames needed a total of 25 putts in his round, including three from just 10 feet on his final hole.

Overnight leader J.P. Hayes was a further stroke back after carding a 69 on the Palm course, having surrendered a one-stroke advantage with one hole to play, the 500-yard ninth.

Hayes, who had opened with a 65, double-bogeyed his final hole after taking a penalty drop off the tee to slide into an eight-way tie for fifth at 10 under.

Among those level with Hayes were Justin Leonard (67), big-hitting Brett Wetterich (65), Sean O'Hair (66) and Vaughn Taylor (67).

Despite bright morning sunshine at the Disney World Resort, course conditions remained soggy and preferred lies were in operation for the second day in a row.

The cut fell at three-under 141 with 89 players qualifying for the weekend. Among those missing out were former major winners Mark Calcavecchia, Tom Lehman, Shaun Micheel and Ben Curtis in danger of missing out.

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon sees no impact from Noel on Sable gas output
entry.body:
CALGARY, Alberta Nov 2 (Reuters) - Production at the Sable natural gas project in the North Atlantic off the Canadian province of Nova Scotia is not expected to be hampered by the remnants of Hurricane Noel, a spokesman for operator Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) said Friday.

Noel, whose intense rains are blamed for as many as 100 deaths in the Dominican Republic this week, is forecast to become an intense extra-tropical storm and pass over Nova Scotia by late Saturday, according to DTN Meteorlogix.

"We've been watching the storm closely, and based on current forecasts we don't expect it to affect our operations offshore," Exxon Mobil spokesman Merle MacIsaac said.

"We'll continue to monitor it to ensure the safety of all our personnel and the integrity of the facilities."

Sable, located 250 km (155 miles) southeast of Halifax, Nova Scotia, produces more than 400 million cubic feet a day. The gas is shipped to Atlantic Canada and New England.

Sable's other partners are Royal Dutch Shell Plc (RDSa.L), Imperial Oil Ltd (IMO.TO), Pengrowth Energy Trust PGF_u.TO and Mosbacher Operating Ltd.

entry.headline: Goldman Sachs denies writedown rumors
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) on Friday denied market speculation that the top U.S. brokerage by market value could announce billions of dollars in writedowns.

"We've said there's no truth to these rumors," said Ed Canaday, a spokesman for the brokerage.

Goldman shares were down 12.23, or 5.1 percent, at $227.98 in late afternoon trading, underperforming the Amex Securities Broker Dealer Index .XBD, which was 3.2 percent lower.

Other brokerages also slid, with Morgan Stanley (MS.N) down 6.9 percent and Merrill Lynch Co Inc MER.N, which the Wall Street Journal reported may have sought to delay billions of dollars in losses on troubled assets by moving them to hedge funds, down 9.1 percent.

Merrill said it was not aware of any inappropriate transactions.

(Reporting by Christian Plumb)

entry.headline: Exxon Mobil Beaumont FCC unit restarting
entry.body:
(Adds details)

NEW YORK Nov 2 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil (XOM.N) said it was restarting the gasoline-making fluid catalytic cracking unit at its 394,000 barrel-per-day refinery in Beaumont, Texas, but had no timeframe for when the unit would actually be up and running.

In the filing with the Texas Commission for Environmental Quality, the company reported an air start-up event caused by the start-up of the FCC unit following unplanned maintenance activities.

"This is a pre-notification report for start-up of the unit once the current maintenance is completed," said Prem Nair, a spokeswoman for the company.

She said the refinery was still running at reduced rates but was unable to give a time when the FCC unit would be restarted.

The unit was shut down on Oct. 13 for unplanned work and was expected to be out of service for three weeks, she said at the time.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Michael Erman
entry.headline: Chevron earnings fall over 25 percent
entry.body:
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Chevron Corp's (CVX.N) third-quarter earnings fell more than 25 percent, missing analyst estimates on sharply lower profits from gasoline production.

Margins to produce gasoline and other refined products plummeted during the quarter as prices for the fuel did not keep pace with surging crude oil prices, dragging down earnings across the industry.

Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N), BP Plc (BP.L), Royal Dutch Shell Plc (RDSa.L), and ConocoPhillips (COP.N) all posted lower third-quarter earnings despite the sky-high oil prices.

Chevron, the No. 2 U.S. oil company, said on Friday its net income dropped to $3.72 billion, or $1.75 a share, from $5.01 billion, or $2.29 a share, a year earlier.

Excluding about $400 million of one-time items, it posted earnings of about $1.94 a share, coming in behind the average analyst estimate of $2.07 a share.

Revenue in the quarter rose to $55.17 billion from $54.21 billion.

U.S. refining margins plummeted by as much as 90 percent from record highs reached in May after the summer driving season ended.

Chevron Chief Executive Dave O'Reilly said in a statement that the company had difficulty recovering its higher fuel costs because the U.S. market was well-supplied with gasoline.

Earnings at the company's refining and marketing segment fell 74 percent to $377 million, including a loss of $110 million from its U.S. refining and marketing operations.

"There are two elements to that red figure. One is more of an industry effect -- margins. The other is an operating effect that is company specific," said Benchmark Company analyst Mark Gilman, who has a "sell" rating on Chevron.

"This company continues to operate its U.S. refining system poorly, and this is chronic."

The company's U.S. refineries processed 168,000 fewer barrels of oil per day than last year, due to a mid-August fire at its Pascagoula, Mississippi, refinery and a planned shutdown at its El Segundo, California, refinery.

Profit from its exploration and production unit dipped to $3.43 billion from $3.5 billion last year.

Chevron's worldwide production dropped about 4 percent to 2.6 million barrels a day, due mainly to changes to the company's operating agreements in Venezuela.

Chevron shares fell 63 cents to $88.41 in early trading on the New York Stock Exchange.

Through Thursday's close, shares of Chevron were up about 21 percent this year, underperforming the Chicago Board Options Exchange's Oil Index .OIX, which rose about 25 percent over the same period.

(Reporting by Michael Erman)

FILED UNDER:

Net income dropped to $3.72 billion, or $1.75 a share, from $5.01 billion, or $2.29 a share, a year earlier.

Margins to produce gasoline and other refined products fell sharply during the quarter, dragging down earnings at most integrated oil companies that both drill for and refine the fuel.

Refining margins plummeted by as much as 90 percent from record highs reached in May as the summer driving season ended, oil prices surged and gasoline prices did not keep up with the price increases.

Shares of Chevron are up about 21 percent this year, underperforming the Chicago Board Options Exchange's Oil Index .OIX, which rose about 25 percent over the same period. (Reporting by Michael Erman)

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-RESEARCH ALERT-Citigroup ups Coca-Cola Enterprises
entry.body:
(Adds brokerage comments, background)

Nov 2 (Reuters) - Citigroup raised Coca-Cola Enterprises Inc (CCE.N) to "buy" from "hold" and cut its rating on the Pepsi Bottling Group Inc PBG.N to "hold" from "buy," saying investors should book gains on PBG's shares and swap those profits into CCE shares.

The brokerage said shares of Coca Cola Enterprises, the largest bottler of Coca-Cola Co (KO.N), are undervalued given Glaceau's expansion to European markets. It raised its price target on the stock to $31 from $25.

Coca-Cola purchased Glaceau, the maker of vitaminwater and smartwater, for $4.1 billion in June in a bid to boost its position in the fast-growing market for noncarbonated drinks.

The brokerage said Glaceau's incremental volumes could add between 19 cents and 27 cents to 2009 earnings per share for Coca Cola Enterprises, and is not fully reflected in consensus estimates.

Citigroup cuts its rating on Pepsi Bottling Group, the largest bottler of PepsiCo Inc (PEP.N), based on valuation and said there was a lack of meaningful catalysts in the near term. It, however, raised its price target on the stock to $46 from $45.

The brokerage said investors should book profits on PBG at this juncture as the stock's valuation is fully reflecting the benefits of its positive performance in 2007 as it is trading close to its historical valuations. (Reporting by Avishek Mishra in Bangalore)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Francois Schott
entry.headline: Hingis tests positive for cocaine
entry.body:
ZURICH (Reuters) - Former world number one Martina Hingis said on Thursday she had tested positive for cocaine during Wimbledon this year and announced her retirement from professional tennis.

"I have tested positive but I have never taken drugs and I feel 100 percent innocent," the five-times grand slam champion from Switzerland told a news conference.

Fighting back tears and with her voice cracking, Hingis read from a written statement before leaving the room without answering questions.

In an expanded version of the statement later released by her management, the 27-year-old said she found the accusation of drug-taking "so horrendous, so monstrous, that I have decided to confront it head-on by talking to the press."

The statement added: "I would personally be terrified of taking drugs. When I was informed (about the test) I was shocked and appalled."

Hingis added that she had undergone a private test that came back negative and consulted an attorney.

"The attorney and his experts discovered various inconsistencies with the urine sample that was taken during Wimbledon.

"He is also convinced that the doping officials mishandled the process and would not be able to prove that the urine that was tested for cocaine actually came from me."

Hingis said she had also been advised that any fight to clear her name could drag on for years.

"I have no desire to spend the next several years of my life reduced to fighting against the doping officials," she said. "I am frustrated and angry.

"I believe that I am absolutely, 100 percent innocent. The fact is that it is more and more difficult for me, physically, to keep playing at the top of the game.

"And frankly, accusations such as these don't exactly provide me with motivation to even make another attempt to do so."

She added: "And so, considering this situation, my age and the problems I have been having with my hip, I have decided to no longer play tennis on the Tour."

After rising to the top of her sport with a much-admired blend of grace and tactical astuteness, Hingis suffered a string of injuries that forced her to first hang up her racket in 2003.

SURPRISE RETURN

She made a surprise return to the courts in 2006, proving her doubters wrong as she went on to win two more titles and end the year as world number seven.

A further, final, title followed in Tokyo this year before her injury problems returned.

In October, Hingis announced an early end to her season, citing hip problems.

Thursday's media conference was widely expected to see the former world number one announcing her retirement -- but not in the circumstances now set out.

The WTA Tour released a brief statement from chief executive officer Larry Scott on Thursday, mainly paying tribute to Hingis's achievements on the court.

"The WTA Tour has not received any official information regarding the positive doping test result referred to... and as a result we are not in a position to comment," Scott began before going on to praise the player's "incredible touch, on-court intelligence and off-court professionalism."

Switzerland's national tennis association also highlighted Hingis's attributes as a player.

"Martina Hingis was a great player who was always a role model and a figurehead for Swiss tennis," association president Rene Stammbach said in a statement.

"We regret very much that Martina is ending her career faced with these recriminations."

(Additional writing by Mark Ledsom in Berne)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 2-Petrobras to acquire Exxon Japan refinery-source
entry.body:
(Recasts, adds details)

TOKYO Nov 2 (Reuters) - Brazilian state oil company Petrobras (PETR4.SA) (PBR.N) will take a majority stake in an Exxon Mobil group (XOM.N) refinery in Okinawa, southern Japan, to tap the fast-growing Asian market, an industry source said on Friday.

Petrobras will buy an 87.5 percent interest in Nansei Sekiyu KK, which operates the 100,000 barrels per day Nishihara refinery, for several billion yen, the source added.

That stake is currently owned by Exxon Mobil's half-owned subsidiary TonenGeneral Sekiyu (5012.T), while Japanese trading house Sumitomo Corp (8053.T) owns the rest.

After the deal, Petrobras and Sumitomo are expected to invest 60 billion yen to 100 billion yen ($520 million-$870 million) to upgrade the refinery and boost output of products such as gasoline, kerosene and jet fuel, the source said.

The source added that after the deal, Petrobras is likely to sell some of its stake to Sumitomo.

Industry sources said Petrobras was aiming to feed its own crude output to the refinery to cut costs in a shrinking Japanese market, where refining margins are low.

Japan's Nikkei business daily said earlier that the agreement would be signed this month and that Sumitomo would likely lift its ownership in the refinery to 20 to 30 percent after TonenGeneral withdraws and join Petrobras in sales of petrochemical products in Asia.

A Sumitomo spokesman said his company was aware that Petrobras and TonenGeneral were in talks but that Sumitomo had not yet made any decisions.

Sumitomo Vice President Noriaki Shimazaki told Reuters last week that the issue had not been put to its board yet.

TonenGeneral Sekiyu said it had not made any decisions on the matter, and an ExxonMobil spokesman in Tokyo declined to comment.

Oil traders have been following the deal since news of it first emerged about a year ago. ($1=114.67 Yen)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Verplank and stumbling Ames share Disney lead
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - Overnight pacesetter Scott Verplank shrugged off a faltering start to hold a share of the lead in the Disney Classic third round at Lake Buena Vista on Saturday.

The American fired a one-under-par 71 for a 13-under total of 203, finishing level with Canada's Stephen Ames (70) in the final event of the 2007 PGA Tour season.

Five-times Tour winner Verplank dropped his first two shots of the week on the fifth and sixth holes before making a late surge with birdies at the 12th and 15th.

Ames, bidding for his third Tour title, broke two clear of a congested leaderboard with three birdies in five holes before losing momentum with three-putt bogeys on 16 and at the last.

"Nobody really did anything up at the top," Verplank, 43, told reporters after a blustery day on the rain-sodden Magnolia course.

"This golf course is still playing really long, making it much harder to hit it close which you occasionally need to do to make a bunch of birdies.

"The good news is I'm tied for the lead but there's got to be 30 guys who have a chance to win."

At one point, five players held a share of the lead as the scoring fluctuated wildly at the Walt Disney World Resort.

BUNCHED LEADERBOARD

By the end of the day, the top 19 players were separated by just three shots going into the final round.

Justin Leonard returned a 70 to share third place at 12 under with fellow Americans Tim Petrovic (68), Tag Ridings (71) and Jeff Overton (69), plus Australian Mathew Goggin (69).

Big-hitting American Brett Wetterich eagled the par-five 10th to move one stroke in front before tumbling back into a tie for ninth spot with a 72.

He bogeyed 12 and 15 and ran up a triple-bogey at the last where he incurred a two-shot penalty after touching a twig that was deemed a loose impediment.

"Brett had branches and sticks all around the ball that were loose impediments," PGA Tour rules official Jon Brendle said.

"He was taking some waggles to see if he could play the ball, accidentally touched the loose impediments and was given a two-stroke penalty."

Compatriot Rich Beem, winner of the 2002 PGA Championship, also vaulted to the top of the leaderboard with five birdies in the first 13 holes.

However, he lost ground with a three-bogey run from the 15th for a 70 to finish level with Wetterich and nine others at 10 under.

Despite bright sunshine, course conditions remained soggy and preferred lies were in operation for the third day in a row.

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: India's Reliance Comm, Microsoft in pact for IPTV - papers
entry.body:
MUMBAI Nov 3 (Reuters) - Reliance Communications (RLCM.BO) has tied up with Microsoft (MSFT.O) for technological collaboration for internet protocol television and software development for mobile phones, Indian newspapers reported on Saturday.

Reliance Communications Chairman Anil Ambani and Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer are expected to make a joint announcement on Monday, when the latter is in India, the Hindustan Times and Business Standard newspapers said.

The papers quoted Ambani telling analysts earlier this week that Reliance Communications would launch IPTV services in Mumbai and Delhi by the end of this year, and had finaised the technological backup for this.

State-run Mahanagar Telephone Nigam Ltd (MTNL.BO) and private sector Bharti Airtel (BRTI.BO) have already launched IPTV services, while several other operators are in the process of rolling out these services.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Disney eyeing theme park site in Malaysia-report
entry.body:
KUALA LUMPUR Nov 3 (Reuters) - Walt Disney Co (DIS.N) is looking to build a theme park on a 500-acre (202-hectare) site in southern Malaysia, a business weekly reported on Saturday.

Citing unnamed sources, the Edge said the theme park, to be located in Bardar Nusajaya in the Iskandar development zone, would be ready six years after a deal was signed, according to early proposals.

The proposed Disneyland theme park and resort is slated to be bigger than Hong Kong Disneyland and about the size of Tokyo Disney Resort, it said.

The government unveiled a $105 billion blueprint late last year to transform the southern tip of Johor state, which neighbours Singapore, into a regional economic zone for industry, logistics, trade and leisure.

Although the talks with Disney are progressing fast, discussions with other theme park operators, including Warner Bros Entertainment and MGM (MGM.N), have not ceased, the Edge said.

"However, a deal with Walt Disney looks most promising as it has expressed its seriousness and has come out with specifications on its requirements," it quoted a source as saying.

If the talks with Disney are successful, a deal is expected to be signed by the middle of next year, it added.

Malaysia's state-controlled UEM World UEMW.KL is developing Bandar Nusajaya, a township in southwest Johor.

The 2,200 square km (850 sq miles) Iskandar zone has so far clinched at least $6 billion in investments, including a $4.7 billion maritime park proposed by Dubai World and Malaysia's infrastructure-to-energy group MMC Bhd (MMCB.KL).

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 1-China blocks Goldman investment in Fuyao Glass
entry.body:
(Adds comments from Fuyao, share price)

SHANGHAI Nov 5 (Reuters) - China's securities regulator has blocked a $119 million deal by Fuyao Group Glass Industries Co (600660.SS) to sell a nearly 10 percent stake to an investment arm of Wall Street bank Goldman Sachs (GS.N), Fuyao said on Monday.

Fuyao, China's top automotive glass maker, said in a statement that it had not won approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission for a proposal to issue shares to Goldman in a private placement.

Goldman agreed in late 2006 to buy 111.28 million shares or a 9.98 percent stake in Fuyao at a price of 8 yuan per share, far cheaper than Fuyao's last market close of 30.69 yuan.

The deal won Ministry of Commerce approval in August, but the securities regulator blocked it, mainly because the government did not want Fuyao to sell the stake too cheaply to foreign investors, which could have prompted protests by Chinese investors, the official China Securities Journal said.

Fuyao's board secretary Chen Yuedan declined to say whether the firm would try to renegotiate the price with Goldman or whether it would raise money in other ways.

"We will make an announcement if we make a decision on a future move," Chen told Reuters by telephone.

Fuyao's shares on the Shanghai Stock Exchange fell 3.55 percent to 29.60 yuan by 0327 GMT, underperforming a 1.44 percent drop in the benchmark index .SSEC.

Several foreign investment deals have been derailed by the bull run in China's stock market, which has lifted companies' share prices far beyond the levels that foreign buyers originally agreed to pay.

In August, the securities regulator blocked a separate plan by Goldman to buy a 10.7 percent stake in Midea 000527.SZ, one of China's top home appliance makers, for about $96 million. Official media said the problem appeared to be the selling price.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Stadler earns 2008 PGA Tour card after Disney nail-biter
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - American Kevin Stadler secured his PGA Tour card for 2008 after a gut-wrenching final round at the Disney Classic in Lake Buena Vista on Sunday.

The beefy 28-year-old squeezed into the top 125 in the money list after tying for 15th in the season-ending event with a 10-under total of 278.

Stadler began the week in 127th and knew he was flirting with the cut-off throughout Sunday's final round at the Walt Disney World Resort.

"I couldn't see it on every board but on most of them out there I was kind of floating around 124, 125, 126 all day," he told reporters after closing with a one-under 71.

"I felt pretty good out on the course but once I finished, it was completely out of my hands. I'm pretty glad it's over."

Stadler, who birdied two of the last six holes, ended his 2007 campaign in 124th place with earnings of $810,876. Swede Mathias Gronberg secured 125th on $785,180 after tying for 37th on Sunday.

In pursuit of his third full season on the PGA Tour, Stadler needed to make a two-putt par from 19 feet on the final hole, and did so after running his approach putt to within two feet.

"It felt like putting for the tournament," he said with a smile. "It's pretty impossible to try and two-putt but that's what I was kind of doing there.

"Obviously I would have liked to make it (the first putt) but my speed was pretty poor all day and I just didn't want to let it get away from me, even though it was uphill."

Stadler, whose father Craig won the 1982 Masters, started the final seven Tour events of this season reasonably safely in 108th spot in the money list before missing three cuts in five tournaments to spiral out of contention.

"I played very poorly for the majority of it and just kind of watched myself sink five, six, eight spots every week, which wasn't much fun," he said.

"But I had a good week this week and I'm glad to be done."

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Ames justifies swing changes with Disney victory
entry.body:
MIAMI (Reuters) - Canada's Stephen Ames validated almost a year of overhauling his swing when he clinched his third PGA Tour title by a shot at the season-ending Disney Classic in Lake Buena Vista on Sunday.

The 43-year-old Trinidad native, who has worked hard to shape a shallower swing to hit the ball higher and further, birdied three of the last six holes to end his 2007 campaign in triumphant style.

Tied for the overnight lead with American Scott Verplank, Ames broke clear of a tightly bunched field for the first time with a nine-foot birdie putt at the par-three 15th.

He calmly parred the last three holes, getting up and down from a greenside bunker on 18, for a four-under-par 68 on the Magnolia course and a 17-under total of 271.

South African Tim Clark, who briefly held the outright lead at 16 under with two holes to play, finished second after closing with a six-birdie 66.

Verplank, hunting his sixth Tour title, edged ahead of the pack three times after making two birdies in the first seven holes.

However, he twice missed birdie putts from inside six feet before slipping back into a tie for third at 14 under with a 71, finishing level with fellow Americans Tag Ridings (70) and Robert Gamez (68).

"This is awesome and it's nice to be back in the winner's circle again," a beaming Ames told reporters after claiming the first prize of $828,000.

ANOTHER REASON

"We were planning on going to Maui for Christmas anyhow and now we have another reason to go."

Apart from earning a two-year exemption on the PGA Tour, Ames also wins a spot in the winners-only field for the opening event of 2008, the Mercedes-Benz Championship in Maui from January 3-6.

Probably most heartening of all, though, for the Canadian is that his swing is holding up smoothly under tournament pressure.

"It is starting to feel natural now where I can get up and feel the shots that I want to hit," said Ames, who was forced to overhaul his swing after suffering back problems toward the end of his 2006 season.

"Today resulted in that and the whole week did altogether."

In bright, breezy conditions at the Walt Disney World Resort, six players held at least a share of the lead during a wildly fluctuating final round.

For much of the day, the rock-steady Verplank appeared to be the likeliest winner.

Birdies at the second and the seventh helped him reach the turn in two-under 34 for a one-shot cushion going into the back nine.

Although Verplank picked up two more shots at the 10th and 14th, his title bid effectively ended at the par-four 16th where he missed a six-footer to save par.

Bryce Molder, boosted by a 20-foot eagle putt at the 14th, and fellow American Jeff Overton briefly held a share of the lead before Ames took control.

The Canadian shrugged off a three-putt bogey at the 11th with three consecutive birdies from the 13th to all but seal the final event of the 2007 PGA Tour.

After a superb bunker shot to three feet at the last, Ames coolly tapped in the victory putt before pumping his right fist in celebration.

(Writing by Mark Lamport-Stokes in Los Angeles)

FILED UNDER:

entry.headline: Exxon L.A. refinery plans Nov. 6-10 flaring -filing

DENVER Nov 4 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp's (XOM.N) 150,000 barrel per day (bpd) Los Angeles market refinery in Torrance, California, filed notice on Friday evening with Los Angeles air pollution regulators on plans to use the plant's safety flare between Nov. 6-10.

The use of the flare is not related to a unit breakdown, according to the notice filed with the South Coast Air Quality Management District.

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Exxon slightly cuts energy demand forecast
entry.body:
NEW YORK Nov 5 (Reuters) - Exxon Mobil Corp (XOM.N) cut its projection for energy demand growth slightly on Monday, saying it expected greater gains from energy efficiency.

Exxon, the largest U.S. oil company, said it now expected worldwide demand for energy to increase by about 1.3 percent a year between 2005 through 2030.

Last year, the company said it expected demand to rise 1.6 percent a year for 2000 through 2030.

Excluding 2000 through 2004, the company forecast growth of 1.4 percent a year over the period.

Most of the growth is expected to come from developing countries, where Exxon sees 2 percent a year demand growth.

In developed countries, Exxon only sees 0.5 percent demand growth.

The company still expects fossil fuels to account for about 80 percent of the energy mix in 2030, with natural gas showing more growth than projected last year and coal slightly less.

Exxon has long been accused by critics of being environmentally unfriendly, working to disprove science supporting climate change and resisting limits on greenhouse gas emissions.

The company said it sees carbon dioxide emissions rising about 2 percent a year through 2030.

It said slowing that growth would require "global participation, step changes in energy efficiency, technology gains and massive investment over decades." (Reporting by Michael Erman)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: Nicole Mordant
entry.headline: CIBC Says Visa Gain Should Offset Debt Writedown
entry.body:
VANCOUVER, British Columbia (Reuters) - Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CM.TO) said on Monday it expects a gain it will earn in the fourth quarter from the restructuring of credit card company Visa Inc. to offset a writedown on the U.S. mortgage-related securities it holds.

At the same time, CIBC's chief executive dismissed market talk that Canada's fourth largest bank may use the money it will get from the sale of the bulk of its U.S. capital markets business to make another acquisition anytime soon.

CEO Gerry McCaughey said that in the current tough environment for banks, one that could remain difficult for some time, preserving its capital was CIBC's top priority.

"A transaction at this time is improbable given our view that capital strength is extremely important," McCaughey said on a conference call to discuss the sale, announced on Sunday, of most of CIBC World Markets' U.S. operations.

"I would see capital strength taking precedence somewhat over capital deployment at this time," he said.

CIBC is due to report its fourth quarter results on Dec. 6. Investors and analysts have been particularly interested to know what further writedowns the bank could face on its book of collateralized debt obligations, or CDOs.

CDOs are pools of loans that have ties to subprime mortgages, a market in the United States that has been pummeled by defaults and resulted in several of the world's largest banks, including Citigroup Inc (C.N) and UBS AG (UBSN.VX) writing off billions of dollars.

"We expect the Visa gain to essentially offset the CDO ... on a pre-tax basis," Chief Financial Officer Tom Woods said on the same conference call.

Woods said CIBC had not yet finalized the writedown amounts on the CDOs. He also declined to give an amount for the Visa gain, which CIBC alerted the market to on Oct. 3 and which several other Canadian banks will also benefit from.

CIBC wrote down C$290 million ($312 million) before tax, or C$190 million after tax, in its third quarter results because of CDOs and residential mortgage-backed securities related to the U.S. mortgage market.

At the time of its third-quarter results in August, CIBC said its overall exposure to the U.S. residential mortgage market before writedowns was approximately US$1.7 billion, excluding exposure directly hedged with other counterparties.

It estimated then that less than 60 percent of this exposure relates to underlying subprime mortgages.

CIBC's shares closed up 5 Canadian cents at C$98.15 on the Toronto Stock Exchange on Monday. Most of its peers were slightly weaker.

The bank said at the weekend it will sell CIBC World Markets' U.S. investment banking, institutional sales, corporate syndicate lending and options trading businesses, plus others, to Oppenheimer Holdings Inc (OPY.N).

Analysts said the U.S. sale reduces "accident prone" CIBC's risk profile but also limits expansion opportunities for the bank, which like other large Canadian banks, faces a mature and competitive banking market at home.

"CIBC is nowhere near as risky a bank as it was at the end of last week," said Dundee Securities analyst John Aiken in a note to clients on the deal.

"This transaction substantially reduces its exposure to the areas of the business that have historically plagued CIBC's results with writedowns and other charges," Aiken said.

CIBC has pulled in its horns in the past two years after it paid out US$2.4 billion to settle lawsuits related to its alleged role in the failed Enron Corp.

(Reporting by Nicole Mordant; Editing by Rob Wilson)

entry.body:
VANCOUVER, British Columbia Nov 5 (Reuters) - Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CM.TO) said on Monday it expects a "large gain" from the restructuring of credit card company Visa Inc. to offset a writedown on U.S. mortgage-related securities in its fourth quarter results.

"We expect the Visa gain to essentially offset the CDO ... on a pre-tax basis," Chief Financial Officer Tom Woods said on a conference call.

Woods said CIBC, Canada's fourth largest bank, had not yet finalized the writedown amounts on the CDOs, or collateralized debt obligations, it holds. CDOs are pools of loans that have ties to subprime mortgages, a market in the United States that has been pummeled by defaults.

CIBC is due to report its fourth quarter results on Dec. 6.

The bank did not provide figures for either the Visa gain or the CDO writedown.

On the same conference call, CIBC Chief Executive Gerry McCaughey poured cold water on any talk the bank was planning to make an acquisition.

"A transaction at this time is improbable given our view that capital strength is extremely important," McCaughey said.

"I would see capital strength taking precedence somewhat over capital deployment at this time," he said. (Reporting by Nicole Mordant; Editing by Rob Wilson)

entry.author: None
entry.headline: UPDATE 1-Class effect not ruled out with Pfizer heart drug
entry.body:
(Recasts, adds comments from study researcher at heart meeting)

By Kim Dixon and Bill Berkrot

ORLANDO, Fla./NEW YORK Nov 5 (Reuters) - Researchers have been unable to nail down the cause of increased deaths that led Pfizer Inc (PFE.N) to drop its once-promising cholesterol drug torcetrapib, leaving a cloud over similar drugs in development by other companies.

Pfizer, the world's biggest drugmaker, halted development of torcetrapib last year after a large study found it raised the risk of death in heart patients.

An analysis of that study did yield new clues about the drug's impact on blood chemistry, but it remains to be seen whether the harmful effects were specific to the Pfizer drug or could spell trouble for the entire class of experimental medicines called CETP inhibitors.

The analysis, presented on Monday at the American Heart Association's annual scientific meeting in Orlando, does not rule out "the possibility that CETP inhibition per se may have adverse effects."

But the lead researchers said clues derived from the analysis of the 15,067-patient Illuminate trial support further review of other drugs in the class.

The trial was halted in December when safety monitors found an unacceptably high rate of deaths and other adverse heart events in the torcetrapib group. It was Pfizer's most promising new product and its most expensive research failure to date.

The drug was designed to raise levels of "good" HDL cholesterol while also lowering "bad" LDL cholesterol. It raised HDL levels by an impressive 72 percent, and lowered LDL levels by 25 percent.

RIVALS LOOK ON

Drugmakers working on similar drugs -- Merck Co (MRK.N), and a collaboration between Switzerland's Roche Holding AG (ROG.VX) and Japan Tobacco Inc (2914.T) -- are closely watching for clues on a class effect.

Philip Barter, the head researcher on the failed trial, said insight from the analysis and several others reports released on Monday suggest there is still hope for CETP inhibitors.

"The trial leaves the way open for further exploration," said Barter, who presented the analysis at the AHA meeting. He said he hoped researchers working on CETP inhibitors had the courage to continue their work on their compounds.

The findings of the analysis and another report released at the meeting appear to derail a theory that certain types of HDL may be harmful.

In fact, the analysis found that the higher the HDL, the lower the rate of harm.

The trial compared two groups of patients -- one taking both torcetrapib and Pfizer's blockbuster drug Lipitor, and the other taking LDL-lowering Lipitor alone. When the study was halted, there were 93 deaths in the torcetrapib group and 59 in the Lipitor-only group.

Causes of death came from both heart and non-heart-related events and included increased rates of death from cancers and infection.

The cancer deaths were not statistically significant, and there was no increase in incidence of new cancers

The rise in infection deaths, which was statistically valid, was a "big surprise," Barter said. "Clearly, for the class of drugs, it's very important," he said.

ELECTROLYTE LINK

An increase in blood pressure had been seen throughout the torcetrapib development program and had long been suspected of being the link to the increased heart problems.

But the drug also appears to have affected levels of electrolytes and other chemicals in the blood in ways that will require further study, according to the new analysis.

Patients in the torcetrapib group had a decrease in potassium and increases in serum sodium, bicarbonate and aldosterone, researchers said.

Review of data found increased risk of death was seen in those patients whose reduction in potassium or increase in bicarbonate was greater than the median change.

Paradoxically, there was increased risk of major cardiac events in patients whose increase in blood pressure was less than the median, researchers said.

Bicarbonate is a chemical that keeps pH levels in the blood from becoming too acid. Aldosterone regulates electrolytes in the body, including sodium and potassium.

Researchers said the mechanism by which torcetrapib increased aldosterone levels is unknown. (Editing by Richard Chang and John Wallace)

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: None
entry.headline: Microsoft defends Facebook stake
entry.body:
MUMBAI (Reuters) - Microsoft Corp Chief Executive Steve Ballmer said on Monday his firm's acquisition of a 1.6 percent stake in socializing Web site Facebook for $240 million was an important investment, not a mistake.

"We didn't make a mistake," Ballmer told reporters on the sidelines of a business conference in Mumbai.

Analysts have said Microsoft paid a steep price on a bet that the three-year-old firm would be able to transform itself into a hub for all sorts of Web activity.

"The valuation of Facebook is still to be determined. Certainly today, it's very, very popular. So for a company like ours that wants to be a pre-eminent presence in this space, it's very important for us," Ballmer said.

"Will Facebook be worth $5 billion, $15 billion or $50 billion some years down the line is really up to their team and how they take it forward."

Ballmer, who joined Microsoft in 1980 at the request of his Harvard classmate Bill Gates, said last month that the company was focusing on up to 20 smaller acquisitions of $50 million to $1 billion each annually rather than mega-deals.

Asked if Microsoft was interested in buying Yahoo Inc, Ballmer said: "My answer is a considered 'no comment'."

"We want to succeed in the online advertising space. What happens with Yahoo, we'll all have to wait and see."

Ballmer, who is going to China on Monday night, said the Chinese market was important to Microsoft and that they were making some progress on the issue of intellectual property rights.

"We've made some progress, and there's better respect for software intellectual property there than there was three years ago," he said.

"That said, it's still lower than in a lot of other countries. So depending on how you look at it, life's getting better, or life's bleak," he said.

In July, officials said pirated software worth $500 million, including counterfeit Microsoft and Symantec products, had been seized in a long-running joint probe by Chinese police and U.S. Federal Bureau of Investigation.

Microsoft has said more than a fifth of its software running globally was pirated and that cracking down on them can boost sales.

Ballmer also said technology companies may face a lower capital spending by businesses because of the turmoil in the financial markets.

"There are some concerns about the impact that interest rates, the debt market problem and defaults might have on business spend," Ballmer said.

"So we will have to keep an eye on it. I don't think things will collapse completely but we do think that there may be some sort of a setback or a cut down to capital spending," he said.

FILED UNDER:

entry.author: David Ward
entry.headline: Microsoft and ESPN are teammates for Xbox Live
entry.body:
LOS ANGELES (Hollywood Reporter) - ESPN has signed a deal to bring full-length games and TV shows to Xbox Live, the online entertainment network for Microsoft's Xbox 360.

Among the offerings available for purchase starting Monday on the Xbox Live Marketplace are days-old, full-length NCAA college football and basketball games, Summer X Games 13 and episodes of such ESPN shows as "World Series of Poker," "The Contender" and "Madden Nation."

ESPN's Xbox Live offerings will kick off with a replay of Saturday's USC vs. Oregon State game.

ESPN has been on Xbox Live's main rival in video downloads, Apple's iTunes, since January 2006.

"This is only the second deal ESPN has done regarding electronic sell-through, and we think it's a fantastic match for our platform and our consumer base, many of whom are avid sports fans," said Ross Honey, senior director of the media and entertainment group at Microsoft.

Pricing for the ESPN content will range from the equivalent of $2 for standard-definition episodes of "Contender" and "Poker" to $2.40 for HD versions. Two-hour football and basketball games will be available within days of their original airing and be priced at $3 for standard definition and $4.50 for HD.

Reuters/Hollywood Reporter

entry.headline: UPDATE 1-RESEARCH ALERT-UBS raises Goldman Sachs price target
entry.body:
(Adds details)

Nov 5 (Reuters) - UBS raised its price target on Goldman Sachs Group Inc (GS.N) to $270 from $245, saying Goldman remains best positioned among the brokers given its business mix, geographic footprint, backlog of principal investments and strong risk culture. From Goldman's perspective, the operating environment outside of mortgages and collateralized debt obligations remains pretty good with healthy investment banking activity, strong volumes in equities and solid asset and wealth management new money flows among others, UBS said.

UBS, which has a "buy" rating on the stock, also raised its 2008 earnings estimates to $20.50 per share from $19.50 per share. (Reporting by Nachiket Kelkar in Bangalore)
